task_summary: The robot arm pours from a jug into a mug located on a table.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop robot arm must locate a mug on a table and pour contents from a jug into it. The main objects involved are the mug (target of pouring) and the jug (source). The process includes object detection, precise approach and alignment, controlled pouring, and safe retreat. Scene is constrained by the surface and object placements; successful pouring requires correct pose and tilt.
preconditions: Mug is present and accessible on the table
stepwise_plan: Move the held jug above the mug's center.
Precisely align the jug for pouring.
Tilt jug to pour into mug with moderate angle.
Cease pouring and safely retreat upward.
success_criteria: Jug contents are transferred into the mug.
Robot retreats to a safe position after pouring.
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect mug: retry visual detection.
Mug occluded or moved: abort pouring and rescan.
Pour spill detected: stop and retreat.
No content transfer detected: repeat pour step if allowed.
task_long_description.termination: Tree ends after the pour is complete and the arm retreats from above the mug.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the mug is currently visible in the scene
Runs visual perception to locate the mug
Moves the end-effector holding the jug high above the mug
Precisely aligns and approaches to pouring pose over the mug
Executes the pouring action from jug to mug
Moves away from the mug after pouring, upward

failure_modes: Pour operation aborted due to occlusion or obstruction
Arm collides or cannot retreat safely
recovery_strategy: Retry mug detection once if not initially visible
Abort pour if object pose is lost, re-align
Stop and retreat on contact or collision events
assumptions: The robot starts with the jug already grasped; gripper operations omitted from this tree, as no clear pregrasp frames or explicit references in contact sheet to picking the jug.
Instruction aligns with visible task in all 9 frames (no conflict). Jug and mug are referenced according to their observed role in the sequence.

expected_success_criteria: Liquid or contents are poured successfully into the mug and not outside.
